summary:
Here is a concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
Recalling previous resolutions on the United Nations Mission of Observers in Prevlaka (UNMOP), 
Considered the report of the Secretary-General on UNMOP and letters from the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia and Croatia.

 Reaffirming Croatia's sovereignty and territorial integrity, 

Noting the stable situation in the UNMOP area, but concern over demilitarization regime violations.

 Authorizes UNMOP to continue monitoring until 15 July 2001.

 Calls on parties to:
- Cease demilitarized regime violations 
- Reduce tension 
- Cooperate with UNMOP 

Urges parties to:
- Resume Prevlaka talks 
- Implement the Agreement on Normalization of Relations 
- Fulfil their commitment to a negotiated resolution 

 Requests parties to report bi-monthly on bilateral negotiations.
The Security Council:
6. Reiterates its call upon the parties to put a comprehensive demining programme in place in the identified minefields in the UNMOP area of responsibility;
7. Requests the United Nations military observers and the multinational stabilization force authorized by the Council in resolution 1088 (1996) of 12 December 1996 and extended by resolution 1305 (2000) of 21 June 2000 to cooperate fully with each other;
8. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
